headline: Higher order derivatives in everyday life?
description:
Hi all, I read a Bloomberg article today (https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-27/fed-raises-rates-by-75-basis-points-to-double-down-on-inflation?srnd=premium) stating the following:

"Powell also said the Fed will slow the pace of increases [to interest rates] at some point"

This is referencing a 3rd derivative (loan obligation = base, interest rate = 1st derivative, change in interest rate = 2nd derivative, pace of changes in interest rate = 3rd derivative).

I was wondering if hackernews had any other interesting examples of higher order derivatives that one might encounter in everyday life.
headline_zh-Hans: 日常生活中的高阶导数？
headline_zh-Hant: 日常生活中的高階導數？
description_zh-Hans:
大家好，我今天读了彭博社的一篇文章（https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-27/fed-raises-rates-by-75-basis-points-to-double-down-on-inflation?srnd=premium），内容如下：

"鲍威尔还表示，美联储将在某些时候放缓[利率]上升的步伐"

这指的是第三阶导数（贷款义务=基础，利率=第一阶导数，利率变化=第二阶导数，利率变化的步伐=第三阶导数）。

我想知道hackernews是否有其他有趣的高阶导数例子，人们在日常生活中可能遇到。
description_zh-Hant:
大家好，我今天讀了彭博社的一篇文章（https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-27/fed-raises-rates-by-75-basis-points-to-double-down-on-inflation?srnd=premium），內容如下：

"鮑威爾還表示，美聯儲將在某些時候放緩[利率]上升的步伐"

這指的是第三階導數（貸款義務=基礎，利率=第一階導數，利率變化=第二階導數，利率變化的步伐=第三階導數）。

我想知道hackernews是否有其他有趣的高階導數例子，人們在日常生活中可能遇到。
